    • getRawClass

      @Nullable public static @Nullable Class<?> getRawClass(@Nonnull @Nonnull Type type)
      Returns the raw class of the given type. The given type must be a Class or ParameterizedType. This method returns the given type itself if it is a Class, or ParameterizedType.getRawType() if it is a ParameterizedType. Returns null if the given type neither be Class nor ParameterizedType, or the raw type is not a Class.
      Parameters:
      type - the given type
      Returns:
      the raw class of given type, or null if the given type neither be Class nor ParameterizedType, or the raw type is not a Class

      Returns:

    • isAssignable

      public static boolean isAssignable(@Nonnull @Nonnull Type assigned, @Nonnull @Nonnull Type assignee)
      Returns whether a type can be assigned by another type. This method is Type version of Class.isAssignableFrom(Class), supporting Class, ParameterizedType, WildcardType, TypeVariable and GenericArrayType.
      Parameters:
      assigned - the type to be assigned
      assignee - the assignee type
      Returns:
      whether a type can be assigned by another type

    • resolveActualTypeArguments

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull List<@Nonnull Type> resolveActualTypeArguments(@Nonnull @Nonnull Type type, @Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> baseType) throws ReflectionException
      Resolves and returns the actual type arguments of the given type, based on the type parameters of the specified base type, in order of those type parameters.

      For example, here is a base type: interface Base<A, B, C>, and a subtype to be resolved: class Sub implements Base<String, Integer, Long>. The result of the resolveActualTypeArguments(subtype, base) will be the list of: [String.class, Integer.class, Long.class].

      The given type to be resolved must be a Class, ParameterizedType or array. If it is a Class, it must be a sub or same type of the base type; if it is a ParameterizedType, its raw type must be a sub or same type of the base type; if it is an array, the base type must also be an array, and this method calls itself with their component types.

      Note this method does not guarantee that all type parameters can be resolved, and unresolved type parameters will be directly returned to the list at the corresponding index.

      Parameters:
      type - the given type to be resolved
      baseType - the specified base type
      Returns:
      the actual type arguments of the given type, based on the type parameters of the specified base type, in order of those type parameters
      Throws:
      ReflectionException - if the given type cannot be resolved

    • typeParametersMapping

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull Map<@Nonnull TypeVariable<?>,@Nullable Type> typeParametersMapping(@Nonnull @Nonnull Type type)
      Returns a map contains the mapping of type parameters for the given type, the key is type parameter, and the value is the actual type argument or inherited type parameter. For example, these types: 
      
     class X extends Y<Integer, Long>
     class Y<K, V> implements Z<Float, Double, V>
     interface Z<T, U, R>

      The result of resolveTypeParameterMapping(X.class) will be: 

      
     T -> Float
     U -> Double
     R -> V
     K -> Integer
     V -> Long
      Parameters:
      type - the given type
      Returns:
      a map contains the mapping of type parameters for the given type

    • replaceType

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull Type replaceType(@Nonnull @Nonnull Type type, @Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> matching, @Nonnull @Nonnull Type replacement) throws ReflectionException
      Resolves the given type and replaces the resolved Class types, which equal to the specified matching type, with the specified replacement. Returns the fully replaced type (or the original type itself if no replacement were made).

      For example, for a type: Map<String, Integer>, the result of replaceType(type, Integer.class, Long.class) is: Map<String, Long>. Note the given type itself can also be replaced.

      This method supports resolving Class, ParameterizedType, WildcardType and GenericArrayType.

      Parameters:
      type - the given type to be resolved
      matching - the specified matching type
      replacement - the specified replacement
      Returns:
      the type after the replacing
      Throws:
      ReflectionException - if an error occurs during the replacing

    • replaceType

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull Type replaceType(@Nonnull @Nonnull Type type, @Nonnull @Nonnull Function<? super @Nonnull Class<?>,? extends @Nonnull Type> mapper) throws ReflectionException
      Resolves the given type, passes resolved Class types to the given mapper, and replaces them with the mapper's results which are not equal to the original passed Class types (via Objects.equals(Object, Object)). Returns the fully replaced type (or the original type itself if no replacement were made).

      For example, for a type: Map<String, Integer>, the result of replaceType(type, t -> Objects.equals(t, Integer.class) ? Long.class : t) is: Map<String, Long>. Note the given type itself can also be replaced if it is a Class and the mapper's result is not equals to it.

      This method supports resolving Class, ParameterizedType, WildcardType and GenericArrayType.

      Parameters:
      type - the given type to be resolved
      mapper - the given mapper
      Returns:
      the type after the replacing
      Throws:
      ReflectionException - if an error occurs during the replacing

    • parameterizedType

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull ParameterizedType parameterizedType(@Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> rawType, @Nonnull @Nonnull Type @Nonnull @RetainedParam [] actualTypeArguments)
      Returns a new ParameterizedType with the specified raw type and actual type arguments.
      Parameters:
      rawType - the raw type
      actualTypeArguments - the actual type arguments
      Returns:
      a new ParameterizedType with the specified raw type and actual type arguments

    • parameterizedType

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull ParameterizedType parameterizedType(@Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> rawType, @Nonnull @Nonnull Type @Nonnull @RetainedParam [] actualTypeArguments, @Nullable @Nullable Type ownerType)
      Returns a new ParameterizedType with the specified raw type, actual type arguments and owner type. The owner type may be null, and if it is null, the owner type will be the result of Class.getDeclaringClass().
      Parameters:
      rawType - the raw type
      actualTypeArguments - the actual type arguments
      ownerType - the owner type
      Returns:
      a new ParameterizedType with the specified raw type, actual type arguments and owner type

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull Type otherType()

      Returns:
      a new instance of Type
